book.title: GT version WS MDS WebMDS: User's Guide

abstract.title: Introduction
abstract.para: WebMDS is a web-based interface for viewing formatted information about Grid resources. In the simplest instance, a web server administrator creates an HTML olink that causes the WebMDS server to collect and format information that is presented to the user. Users can also use web forms to specify parameters that control what information is collected and how it's presented.

chapter.title: Visualizing the Index Service with WebMDS
chapter.para: Once you've deployed the WebMDS servlet, simply point your web browser at http://your-tomcat-host:your-tomcat-port/webmds and click on the link labelled "A list of resources registered to the local default index service". For more information, see .
For more detailed information about changing the look of WebMDS and more advanced configuration, see the WebMDS Admin Guide.

chapter.title: Troubleshooting
chapter.para: The commonly-used WebMDS plugins do resource property queries; the Globus Toolkit wsrf-query can be used to determine whether the desired information is available directly from the resource.
